(0, 3289).name: epigenetic regulation
(0, 3289).label: process
(0, 3289).description: The mechanisms by which cells control gene expression through reversible modifications to DNA, histones, or other components of chromatin, without altering the underlying DNA sequence

(0, 3289).name: epigenetic modulation
(0, 3289).label: process
(0, 3289).description: The reversible and dynamic changes in gene expression that occur through epigenetic mechanisms, such as DNA methylation, histone modification, and chromatin remodeling

(0, 3289).name: epigenome
(0, 3289).label: concept
(0, 3289).description: The complete set of epigenetic modifications present in an organism's genome, which influences gene expression and cellular behavior

(0, 3289).name: epigenomic drugs
(0, 3289).label: instrument
(0, 3289).description: Pharmacological agents that target epigenetic mechanisms to modulate gene expression, used for therapeutic purposes, such as cancer treatment

(0, 3289).name: epigenetics
(0, 3289).label: field
(0, 3289).description: The study of heritable changes in gene function that occur without a change in the underlying DNA sequence, involving the regulation of gene expression through epigenetic mechanisms
